creator: mike.rumph@oracle.com
text:
The following page in the mod_fcgid documentation appears to have broken links:

- http://httpd.apache.org/mod_fcgid/mod/mod_fcgid.html 

For example, clicking on mod_cgi in the summary section gives the following error:

The requested URL /docs/trunk//x1/www/httpd.apache.org/content/mod_fcgid/mod/mod_cgi.html was not found on this server.

And clicking on "Dynamic Content With CGI" at the end of the summary section gives the following error:

The requested URL /docs/trunk//x1/www/httpd.apache.org/content/mod_fcgid/howto/cgi.html was not found on this server.

Fixed in r1602711, sort of.

The larger problem is that mod_fcgid is outside of the main httpd tree in svn. When the docs build, they use the main docs build process which assumes that all the other docs are in the same directory. Which they aren't.

Probably the *right* solution is to use a full URL in the XML ...
creator: rbowen@apache.org
rbowen@apache.org
text:
I've put the whole URL into the seealso links, which is probably the right longer term solution. Mike, I don't know how to rebuild this stuff. Did you copy the entire style directory over?

Buildfile: build.xml
/home/rbowen/devel/apache/mod_fcgid/docs/manual/style/description.xml could not be found

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: I tried to copy the style dir over, and rebuild, and the diff was alarmingly large. Leaving for Mike to rebuild, please.

creator: mike.rumph@oracle.com
text:
Rich,

I see that you checked in a change to mod_fcgid.xml in r1602717.
I was able to build (generate) mod_fcgid.html, mod_fgcid.html.en and mod_fcgid.xml.meta by a round about method.
I copied mod_fcgid.xml over to my httpd/trunk/docs/manual/mod directory, and built the generated files there.
This also generated changes to several other files which are due to the presence of mod_fcgid documentation where it isn't intended.
(mod/allmodules*, mod/directives*, mod/index*, mod/quickreference* and sitemap*)
build/build.sh build/build.sh validate-xml and build/build.sh validate-xhtml all worked successfully.


I copied mod_fcgid* back to my mod_fcgid SVN check out.
"svn status" showed that only mod/mod_fcgid.html.en had changed.
I checked this in with r1602959.
I then reverted all of the changes to my httpd/trunk SVN check out.

It appears that the Apache HTTP Server website has not been updated at the following link:

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/trunk/mod/mod_cgi.html 

Thanks,

Mike
